Entries.default: You stand before the shining portal that devoured the dragon. This close, you see it is a ragged-edged tear in the world.

When the light fades and at last you can see again, a great, shaggy aurochs stands before you. A bone-snapping chill radiates from the creature.

It is the manifestation of Rymrgand.
"Passing through the breach will shred your soul into its constituent parts, to little more than wayward motes of essence."
"What happened to the dragon?"
"Your breach will freeze the Deadfire if you don't close it."
"That is unfortunate for you."
"You have to do something!"

"All the world will fall to cold, to equilibrium - it is inevitable.

"I would not delay it."
"Then I'll close the breach myself."

"But you lack the means to enter the Vytmádh and survive the journey.

"You must seek the Eye of Rymrgand, a relic that once belonged to my vassal, Rynhaedr.

"It is a cold, blue stone, and it lies somewhere within this temple."
"I would rather watch you fail than bar your entry."
"I'll find the relic."
"Approach the Vytmádh once the relic is yours. It will grant your soul safe passage into my realm."
"The White Void's only purpose is to destroy souls, and it is adept at doing so."

When his words fall silent and only the shriek of the wind through the breach remains, the light flares again then quickly dies.

You open your eyes and find the Beast gone.
[Show Rymrgand the relic.] "You mean this?"
"Indeed."
The blinding light of the breach pulses in time with the heartbeat of Eora. Your soul pulses in response.
[Enter the breach.]
[Enter the breach.]
[Leave.]

As you near the breach, the pulsing in your soul quickens. A sudden yearning overwhelms you, and before you've had a moment to second-guess your actions, you reach toward the light. Your soul is ripped from you and shredded into countless threads of essence. Your lifeless body collapses to the ground. You have met your final end.
"Herald of Berath, you teeter on the very precipice of your death."
"To once again violate my realm... do you desire dissolution after all?"
"You are bold in your trespasses. I would have thought you had learned your lesson after our previous... encounter."
"You don't care?"
"What is this? A sudden change of heart? It is unlike you to do aught but what benefits yourself."
"Magran's flame does burn brightly in you, doesn't it?"

"Feeling homesick, are you? Did you so miss the chill of my breath on the back of your neck?

"I am flattered."
"You must grow impatient with Eothas' slow trudge toward the end that you would seek it for yourself."

"Have you come to offer your services again? Perhaps I may yet find a use for you.

"But what the goddess of death has touched is hers alone. For now."

"Do you so tire of the pantheon that you seek me out specifically? I am flattered.

"I have nothing more to say to them. They are petty fools to the one, created in the image of the kith that made them."
"Have you come at last to make good on your threat?"
[Attack] "You will fall by my hand!"
[Clear your throat.] "Uh, about that..."
A deep, dry chuckle reverberates throughout the chamber. It shakes the platform beneath your feet.
You are momentarily weightless, formless, free - and then you know no more.

"Do the sharp talons of fear grip your heart, Watcher, now that you stand before the end of all things?

"Pitiful."
As you near, the portal flares bright, brighter, too bright to stand.
"You must have me confused with another kith. I would never taunt a god."
"Give my regards to your many-eyed god."
"No."
"I'm tired, Rymrgand. I'm ready for this all to be over."
"Eora asks much of you and gives you little in return. I, however, will give you the peace you yearn for."
Rymrgand exhales a long, satisfied sigh.
"I have work yet to do."
"Yes, Berath does keep their hound on a short leash."
"Should you ever want for a final freedom from the Pallid Knight's grasp, seek me. I will gladly grant it."
Then comes a crack and moan like ice calving.
"Neriscyrlas has bound her soul to a relic from the days when the gods walked Eora as titans."
"This relic lies in the Beyond - and it holds her soul captive there."
"I do not."
"Knowing that - what do you want?"
"Her soul was drawn through the breach, the Vytmádh, and into the Beyond."
"What's the difference between the Vytmádh and the White Void?"
"The Vytmádh is the gaping maw of entropy. The White Void is the hunger that gnaws at the guts of Eora and cannot be sated."
[Shrug.]
"Let's make a deal."
"That you trust still in me or any god to deal honestly with you... It is remarkable. Naive, but remarkable."
[Shrug.] "That's faith."
Rymrgand snorts derisively. A spray of ice crystals hangs in the air a moment before it's scattered by the roaring wind.
[Leave] "Forget it."
The low rumble of Rymrgand's laughter shakes the temple.
"Is that why this iceberg is here?"
"Yes. The iceberg is the natural result of Neriscyrlas' desperate attempt to evade death."

"Every time she escapes from the Beyond into the Here, she tears the hole a little wider.

"And so the chill of my realm spreads."
"One final thing, Watcher."
"Approach the Vytmádh with the relic in hand. It will grant your soul safe passage into the Shattered Realms."
"Should you fall to their predations, not even Berath will be able to save you."
Rymrgand pauses, his dark cluster of eyes watching you intently.
"You must destroy that dragon."
"Who is Neriscyrlas?"
"That is the name the dragon chose for herself."
"Do not scuttle away just yet, Herald of Berath."

"Should you return, know that you lack the means to enter the Vytmádh and survive the journey.

"You must seek the Eye of Rymrgand, a relic that once belonged to my vassal, Rynhaedr. It is a cold, blue stone, and it lies somewhere within this temple."

"Do not forget that you will need to seek the Eye of Rymrgand if you wish to enter the Vytmádh.

"It is a cold blue stone, and it lies somewhere within this temple."
[Say nothing.]
[Glare silently.]
"And your cult, the Harbingers - what about them?"

"They have done as kith always do - they have claimed for themselves a place that is not their own.

"They are no concern of mine."
"However, there is something you may do for me."
"Like a maggot, the dragon Neriscyrlas has burrowed beneath the skin of my realm."
"Destroy her."
"No. I'm not your errand boy."
"With pleasure."
"There is something you may do for me."
"Ah, initiative. Excellent."
A low rumble shakes the ground beneath your feet.
"What's in it for me?"
"Indeed. You are Berath's."

"But in this instance, my interests are yours.

"After all, it shall be difficult for you to persist in living when Eora is encased in ice."
"Fine, I'll do it."
"A temporary reprieve from my inevitable victory."
"Good."
"Why do you want the dragon dead?"
"She has made herself immune to destruction by my hand, and in so doing, she mocks the very essence of my realm."
"Oh, great. Another god."
"I was wondering when you would show up."
"I wondered not one whit about you."
"You again?"
"One among many, yes, but they are more my court than council, and they cower before me."
"I would ask the same of you."
"Remind me who you are? There are so many gods - it's hard to keep track."
"I am Rymrgand."

A frigid wind blasts from the mouth of the portal, engulfing you in a storm of dancing snow.

You can't catch your breath. You can hardly keep your feet.
"You will remember me now."
"I know you're the Enigmatic God of Cold and all, but I need more to go on than that."
"I see."
"Eradicate the dragon, and the Vytmádh will close, sparing your precious realm the insatiable cold of the White Void."
"I will not stop my servants there from their work. They will treat you no differently than any wayward soul."
When the wind dies down at last and you can finally breathe again, your extremities have gone white from the cold. You cannot feel your hands.
"Why do you think I will succeed where you have failed?"
[Laugh.] "So a kith can do what the great god Rymrgand cannot?"
"The relic she bound her soul to has proven impervious to my influence."
[Say nothing.]
"I see."

"I can yet do many things, Herald of Berath."

A rime of frost grows at your feet. It coalesces, hardens, begins to climb your legs. You're rooted in place, your limbs slowly growing numb.
"You don't scare me, you overgrown cow!"
"Okay, okay, I'm sorry! I take it back!"
[Say nothing.]
The ice climbs your waist. It squeezes tight around your chest. Every breath you take is shallower than the last. Spots dance before your eyes.
"Wise words."
The ice encasing your legs splinters and falls away. Unable to feel your feet, you tumble to the ground. You spend a long, undignified moment trying to right yourself.
[Spit on him.] "Fuck the gods and fuck you in particular."

The ice climbs to cover your mouth, your head. When you are completely encased in ice, it begins to climb down your throat. The cold burns in your belly.

Rymrgand freezes you from the inside out.
The ice encasing your legs splinters and falls away. Unable to feel your feet, you tumble to the side, but are ably caught by [Specified 0].
A satisfied sigh escapes Rymrgand's decaying, bovine mouth.
A satisfied sigh escapes Rymrgand's decaying, bovine mouth.
A satisfied sigh escapes Rymrgand's decaying, bovine mouth.

The ice climbs to cover your mouth, your head. When you are completely encased in ice, it begins to climb down your throat. The cold burns in your belly.

As your companions look on in horror, Rymrgand freezes you from the inside out.
"What relic?"
"It is one of the many things kith have thrown into the Beyond in hopes it might be devoured by the White Void."
"Why did the dragon bind her soul to it?"
"I see."
"The relic cannot be destroyed. In her ignorance, Neriscyrlas hoped that tying her soul to it would save her from death."
"She is mistaken. True death has not claimed her yet, but it will. It is inevitable."
"She is already dead. She refuses to acknowledge it."
